MCAN_BitTimingParams_t Struct Reference
CANFD Driver » CANFD Driver Internal Data Structures

Data structure defines the parameters for bit timing calculation. Bit timing related to data phase will be valid only in case where MCAN is put in CANFD mode and will be '0' otherwise. More...

#include <drivers/canfd/include/canfd_internal.h>

Data Fields

uint32_t nomRatePrescalar

uint32_t dataTimeSeg2
 
uint32_t dataSynchJumpWidth
 

Detailed Description

Data structure defines the parameters for bit timing calculation. Bit timing related to data phase will be valid only in case where MCAN is put in CANFD mode and will be '0' otherwise.

Field Documentation

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::dataRatePrescalar

Data Baud Rate Pre-scaler Range: [0x0-0x1F]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::dataSynchJumpWidth

Data (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Range: [0x0-0xF]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::dataTimeSeg1

Data Time segment before sample point Range: [0x0-0x1F]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::dataTimeSeg2

Data Time segment after sample point Range: [0x0-0xF]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::nomRatePrescalar

Nominal Baud Rate Pre-scaler Range: [0x0-0x1FF]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::nomSynchJumpWidth

Nominal (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Range: [0x0-0x7F]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::nomTimeSeg1

Nominal Time segment before sample point Range: [0x0-0xFF]

uint32_t MCAN_BitTimingParams_t::nomTimeSeg2

Nominal Time segment after sample point Range: [0x0-0x7F]
